content.description: This route is reached by heading right from the notch and making your way along the base of the cliffline (not up the steep hill, nor down the road).  Crimpy moves with a few underclings - finesse your way to the anchors.

Start by stemming between the detached boulder and the wall. Decide when to leave the comfort of the ledge and commit to the face. Climb on pockets and edges to the anchor. As of early 2021, this route has a good bit of lichen / dirt on it - bring a brush.
content.location: The next line right from Quantum Narcissist, this route starts on the vertical face, behind a detached boulder. It is the leftmost route on this face.

content.description: Climb solid holds up the faint dihedral to a shutdown boulder problem. Smack the sloper as hard as you can and power out left to a decent rest. Power through a few more moves then enjoy easier terrain up the arÃªte feature.
content.protection: 6 bolts to an anchor -- two hangers w/one quick link each.
content.location: In the middle of the short, steep wall. This follows the lightning bolt feature/crack up the wall.

content.description:
Given 5 stars in the 3rd edition of the Red River Gorge guidebook, this route lured us with promises of steep rock and great movement, but only proved to be a 2 star, one-move-wonder with some easy huecos at the top.

Climb up into a scoop, and move left onto the face using small edges to reach better holds and huecos which trend towards the arete.

Watch out for the copious amount of poison ivy at the base of this climb!
content.protection: Bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Look for a large scoop/hole.  PLJ is to the left.

content.description: Climb underclings and slopers past several tough moves that do not really let up.
content.location:
From where the road passe through the notch in the cliff traverse right along the cliff face below a ladder that leads to the top of the cliff until you hit see an open area with three bolted routes. This is the middle route.

There really is no trail just a bushwack.

content.description: Layback up the flake placing a couple cams until it cuts directly right. Eye up the face above and crimp your way through sharp edges to the chains.
content.location: Far right on the short, vert wall that is just up and right of the gap. Follows the obvious flake system just before the chimney.

content.description:
Climb up a few feet of choss to reach the low roof. Figure out how to use the few holds available to pull yourself up and over onto the slab. A few more thin moves lead to enjoyable climbing on pockets and edges to the top.

Still pretty dirty, but certainly has potential to improve with more traffic.
content.location: Just through the gap at Far Side on your left. Only a few feet around the right corner from Dirty Sanchez. New line of glue-ins up the middle face.

content.description: This route follows the striking arete on the left-most wall in the notch.  Pull the low overhang to a seemingly featureless arete, which steepens to overhanging through a few difficult bulges.  Move gradually onto the face through the route, but take advantage of some key holds on the arete the entire way.  Easier climbing near the top leads to a 3-bolt anchor.
content.location: Located on the obvious arete on the left of the notch as you reach the top of the hill.

content.description: Pull onto the wall on small crimps and continue up to a hard boulder on thin, sharp blades of rock, a lot of which are upside-down. Pop out right to a mini-dihedral feature that takes you to the chains.
content.location: Climbs the line of crimps on the far right of this wall, just before the ground steepens into the gully. Follows a faint dihedral/crack feature for the last bolt.

content.description: Start off a large boulder at the base and pull through two thin boulder problems back-to-back. Finish up easier technical terrain with a little sting at the end, if you don't find the right holds.
content.location: Far right side of the vertical wall. This is currently the right-most line and starts off a large boulder at the base.
